articles.title: A Hidden Benefit of Implicit Joins: Join Elimination
articles.description: One of jOOQ’s key features so far has always been to render pretty much exactly the SQL that users expect, without any surprises – unless some emulation is required to make a query work, of course. This means that while join elimination is a powerful feature of many RDBMS, it isn’t part of jOOQ’s feature … Continue reading A Hidden Benefit of Implicit Joins: Join Elimination →

articles.title: jOOQ 3.19’s new Explicit and Implicit to-many path joins
articles.description: jOOQ 3.19 finally delivers on a set of features that will greatly simplify your queries further, after jOOQ 3.11 introduced implicit to-one joins: What are these features? Many ORMs (e.g. JPA, Doctrine, jOOQ 3.11 and others) support “path joins” (they may have different names for this concept).
